text: Kim Yo-han (, born September 22, 1999), also known by the mononym Yohan (), is a member of the boy group WEi. He is a South Korean singer and actor. He is a former member of South Korean boy group X1 finishing first on Produce X 101. He made his solo debut with the digital single "No More" on August 25, 2020. ==Early life== Yohan was born on September 22, 1999, in Jungnang District, Seoul, South Korea. He has two younger sisters. ==Career== ===Pre-debut=== Prior to his debut, Yohan was a national taekwando athlete. He was a two-time champion at the National Youth Sports Festival. ===2019: Produce X 101 and X1 === In May 2019, Yohan participated in the Mnet reality-survival program Produce X 101, to form an eleven-member boy group that would promote for 5 years under Swing Entertainment, despite having only three months of training. Yohan finished first in the competition, and debuted as a member and center of X1 on August 27, 2019, with its debut showcase held at Gocheok Sky Dome. However, X1 would later disband on January 6, 2020 due to allegations of vote- rigging in the show. ===2020: Solo carrier, debut with WEi=== Yohan was in talks to join the School series, School 2020. It was later confirmed in February 2020, with the show slated to air in August 2020. In April 2020, it was reported that the series had been cancelled by KBS due to casting controversy over the female lead role. On June 17, 2020, Oui Entertainment announced that they will be debuting a new boy group, tentatively called "OUIBOYZ", in the second half of the year. Yohan is expected to be a part of this group, alongside label mates Kim Dong-han, Jang Dae-hyeon, and Kang Seok- hwa. On July 10, 2020, Oui Entertainment launched social media accounts for their new boy group called "WEi" which Yohan has been confirmed to be a member of. They also released an image film for the logo. Yohan was also announced as an MC for the first day of the 26th Dream Concert "CONNECT:D". On August 6, 2020, it was announced that Yohan would be releasing a solo song, in the form of a digital single, on August 25, 2020, ahead of his future debut with WEi, titled "No More", produced by Zion.
